articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli air strikes killed at least 50 Palestinians in Gaza, local health authorities said, as Israel continues its bombardment despite mounting international pressure to stop military operations and allow aid into Gaza unimpeded.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza as criticism of Israel grows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran received and is reviewing a proposal for a fifth round of nuclear talks with the United States, Deputy Foreign Minister Kazem Gharibabadi said on Tuesday, according to state media.
articles.title: Iran reviewing proposal for 5th round of nuclear talks

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Kristina Cooke
articles.description: Wendy Ortiz was surprised to find out she was being fined by U.S. immigration authorities for being in the country illegally - but it was the amount that truly shocked her: $1.8 million.
articles.title: Trump administration fined this low-income migrant $1.8 million

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: Israel's easing of humanitarian aid access to Gaza is insufficient, France's foreign minister said on Tuesday, warning its ally that the new offensive on Gaza had to stop or there would be consequences.
articles.title: Israel's aid access to Gaza insufficient, offensive must stop, France says

articles.author: Sonia Rolley, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: Congolese minerals such as tungsten, tantalum and tin, which Kinshasa has long accused neighbouring Rwanda of illegally exploiting, could be exported legitimately to Rwanda for processing under the terms of a peace deal being negotiated by the U.S., three sources told Reuters.
articles.title: US-led peace talks could boost Rwandan processing of Congo minerals, sources say

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The United Nations has received permission from Israel for about 100 more aid trucks to enter Gaza on Tuesday, a spokesperson for its humanitarian office said.
articles.title: UN has permission for 100 more aid trucks to enter Gaza, official says

articles.author: Vanessa Balintec, Zoe Law
articles.description: The current political climate, especially in the nation's capital, has sapped some of the expected joy from would-be participants.
articles.title: Some athletes skip Washington's World Pride events, wary of Trump's America

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Qatar dismissed concerns about its offer to give U.S. President Donald Trump a Boeing plane, saying it was not trying to buy influence, a day after a bill was introduced in the Senate to prevent a foreign aircraft operating as Air Force One.
articles.title: Qatar dismisses concerns over offer of aircraft to Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The candidates still in the running to become Poland's president were given lists of demands from two far-right politicians supported by more than a fifth of voters on Tuesday, as they compete to broaden their appeal.
articles.title: Poland's far-right lays down demands to presidential hopefuls

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British anti-Islam activist Stephen Yaxley-Lennon on Tuesday won a bid to trim his 18-month sentence for contempt of court, meaning he will be released from jail within a week.
articles.title: Jailed UK anti-Islam activist 'Tommy Robinson' to be released next week
